intro: Sphaerostigma spirale, commonly known as the spiral sphaerostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, spiraled pattern that sets it apart from other species. Sphaerostigma spirale is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
